conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F due to gravity.
A falls straight down until its lower face touches the upper face of C and the upper edge of D.
B drops and hits the top of the grey block F with the little violet block E fitted inside it.
B quickly loses the small remaining downward speed.
Because the table top is horizontal and the contact surfaces are flat, neither A nor B has any place to slide.
A ends up resting quietly on top of C/D.
B ends up resting quietly on top of E/F.
No block topples or slides any farther once the two impacts have been absorbed.
